author: sky.cactus
content: <@486501030046203915> What is your intuition on the correlation between base fee changes and state growth?

author: sky.cactus
content: I *believe* that if you take some window of time and the base fee is higher at the end than at the beginning, then net state growth over that period of time will be higher than state growth without 1559 or if the base fee started and ended at the same level.

author: sky.cactus
content: Inversely, I believe that if the base fee ends lower than it started then the net state growth will be lower than expected average state growth for that time.

author: sky.cactus
content: What I'm less certain about is whether or not the speed at which the base fee changes plays a role in state growth.  If you have 100 full blocks in a row, does state growth look the same as if you started from the same point but had 200 half full blocks in a row?
